bool IsValid ()
 Check integrity of interval start/stop positions (start>=1 and stop>=start).
bool CheckValid (bool quiet=false)
 Same as GenomicInterval::IsValid, but it also prints error messages.
bool IsBefore (GenomicInterval *I, bool sorted_by_strand)
 Compares with input interval I and returns true if its order is before I. The order is determined first by chromosome, then by strand, and finally by start position.
bool IsPosBefore (GenomicInterval *I)
 Compares with input interval I and returns true if its position order is before I. The position order is determined first by start position and then by stop position.
bool IsCompatibleWith (GenomicInterval *I, bool ignore_strand)
 Compares with input interval I and returns true if intervals are in the same chromosome and strand.
bool OverlapsWith (GenomicInterval *I, bool ignore_strand=false)
 Returns 'true' if it overlaps with input interval I.
void SetCoordinates (long int start, long int stop)
 Set start/stop positions to new values.
long int GetCoordinate (char *op)
 If: op='1' returns start position, op='2' returns stop position, op='5p' returns 5-prime, op='3p' returns 3-prime.
size_t GetSize ()
 Returns interval size.
char * GetSeq (Chromosomes *C, bool replace=false)
 Extracts genomic interval sequence from chromosomal sequences supplied in C. If parameter replace is true, it replaces "N" with lowercase "a".
size_t GetSeqLength (Chromosomes *C)
 Returns sequence length excluding 'N' characters.
long int CalcOverlap (GenomicInterval *I, bool ignore_strand)
 Calculates the overlap with input interval I.
long int CalcDistanceFrom (GenomicInterval *I, char *op, char *I_op)
 Calculates the distance from input interval I based on position operators op and I_op.
int CalcDirection (GenomicInterval *i, bool sorted_by_strand)
 Returns -1 if before interval i, +1 if after, and 0 if the intervals overlap. The order is determined first by chromosome, then (optionally) by strand and finally by start position.
void PrintSeq (Chromosomes *C, bool replace=false)
 Prints genomic interval sequence from chromosomal sequences supplied in C. If parameter replace is true, it replaces "N" with lowercase "a".
void ReverseStrand ()
 If interval strand is '+', it is changed to '-' and vice versa.
void ShiftPos (long int start_shift, long int stop_shift, bool strand_aware)
 Shifts interval start/stop positions. First it chooses reference position, and then shifts start and stop positions separately.
void ModifyPos (char *position_op, long int position_shift)
 Modifies interval start/stop positions. First it chooses which position to keep fixed, and then it shifts the non-fixed position.
void ReversePos (StringLIntMap *bounds)
 Reverses interval start/stop positions with respect to chromosomal bounds, as if the reference point were in the end of the chromosome as opposed to the beginning.
bool CheckBounds (StringLIntMap *bounds, bool ignore)
 Checks if interval start/stop positions comply with chromosomal bounds.
void ApplyBounds (StringLIntMap *bounds)
 Corrects interval start/stop positions so as to comply with chromosomal bounds.
void PrintBEDFormat (char *color, bool convert_chromosome)
 Prints in BED format. If convert_chromosome is 'true', then convert from ENSEMBL to UCSC names (by adding 'chr' prefix to each chromosome name, and by converting 'MT' to 'chrM').
void Randomize (gsl_rng *random_generator, StringLIntMap *bounds)
 Randomizes interval position within chromosomal bounds.
void GetOffsetFrom (GenomicInterval *ReferenceI, char *op, bool ignore_strand, long int *start_offset, long int *stop_offset)
 Computes start/stop offset distances from ReferenceI.

unsigned long int n_line

 chromosome name (space and tab characters are not allowed)

 orientation ('+' or '-')

 interval start position in the chromosome (>=1)
long int STOP
 interval stop position in the chromosome (<=chromosome_size)

Detailed Description

set of CIGAR operations that map to the fragment sequence (SAM format)

This class implements the genomic interval.

Genomic intervals can be constructed from strings that follow this format:

CHROMOSOME <SPACE> STRAND <SPACE> START <SPACE> STOP

Example: 

    GenomicInterval x("chr1",'+',132034,135932);
    GenomicInterval y("chr1 + 135832 140102");
    cout << "size of interval x = " << x.GetSize() << '\n';
    cout << "size of interval y = " << y.GetSize() << '\n';
    cout << "overlap of x and y = " << x.GetOverlap(&y) << '\n';

Member Function Documentation

void GenomicInterval::ShiftPos ( long int  start_shift,
long int  stop_shift,
bool  strand_aware 
)

Shifts interval start/stop positions. First it chooses reference position, and then shifts start and stop positions separately.

Parameters:
start_shift determines the shift of the start position
stop_shift determines the shift of the stop position
strand_aware if 'true', then start=5-prime and stop=3-prime

void GenomicInterval::ModifyPos ( char *  position_op,
long int  position_shift 
)

Modifies interval start/stop positions. First it chooses which position to keep fixed, and then it shifts the non-fixed position.

Parameters:
position_op selects fixed position as follows: '1'=start position, 'c'=center position, '5p'=5-prime, '3p'=3-prime
position_shift determines the shift of the non-fixed position (in the 'c' case, both positions are shifted symmetrically around the center)

void GenomicInterval::GetOffsetFrom ( GenomicInterval *  ReferenceI,
char *  op,
bool  ignore_strand,
long int *  start_offset,
long int *  stop_offset 
)

Computes start/stop offset distances from ReferenceI.

Parameters:
ReferenceI pointer to reference interval
op selects reference point: '1'=start position, '2'=stop position, '5p'=5-prime position, '3p'=3-prime position
ignore_strand ignore mismatch between test and reference strand
start_offset return value: the start offset
stop_offset return value: the stop offset
